intro: Phaleria okapensis, commonly known as the Okapensis Cabbage Tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, white or yellowish flowers. The plant is often grown as an ornamental due to its striking foliage and unique appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Phaleria okapensis is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
